meanings.sent1: The strong tree upbore the weight of the swinging child.
meanings.sent2: She upbore her friend during the difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The loyal dog upbore the heavy bag of groceries for its owner.
meanings.sent4: His encouraging words upbore her spirits like a sturdy pillar.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy bridge upbore the weight of the passing cars effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: She upbore the pain with a brave face.
meanings.sent2: He upbore the criticism without getting upset.
meanings.sent3: The student upbore the boring lecture by doodling in their notebook.
meanings.sent4: She upbore the cold weather like a true champion.
meanings.sent5: The old tree upbore the harsh winds year after year without complaint.

meanings.sent1: The crane upbore the heavy load effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: He upbore the trophy with pride.
meanings.sent3: The magician upbore the rabbit out of the hat to the amazement of the audience.
meanings.sent4: The sun slowly upbore above the horizon, bringing light to the world.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds upbore the kite high into the sky.
